sourceDesc.p: Journal was created by speaker Tisu during and about the activities of his trip to Vienna 3rd-14th August 2017.

sourceDesc.ab: Journal was created by speaker Tisu during and about the activities of his trip from Alameda California to Vienna Austria from 2017-08-03 to 2017-08-11.

Content was recorded using Translation-based elicitation using a list of desired vocab terms and phrases English and/or Spanish; and Contextual elicitations in which the speaker gave examples of the elicited terms in various sentence contexts.

taxonomy.desc: Typology of linguistic speech events captured in recordings as per: Himmelmann (1998). aka Typology of "naturalness".

category.catDesc: Observed communicative event: the extent of external interference is limited to the knowledge of the speakers that the speech is being recorded or observed.

Staged communicative event: speech events realized for the purpose of recording (i.e. elicited speech). Events are not really being realized for the purpose of communication but for the benefit of the investigator.
Staged-Topical: Prompt to speak freely about topic
Staged-Stimuli: events based on stimuli to be described in speakers own words
Elicitation: speech act for the sole purpose of linguistic investigation. (A new type of speech event for most communities).
Contextualizing elicitation: where native speakers are asked to provide contexts for an item or construction as prompted by the investigator.
Translation-based elicitation: native speaker asked to translate item from second language
Judgement: where native speakers are asked to judge the acceptability of a given construction based on any aspect of language, e.g. grammar, etc.

normalization.ab:
Normalizations were made to the original text by the author by the editor in order to adhere to the precedent set in the orthographic system used in the SIL publications. They are encoded in //w[@orig]. Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per: ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml.
Normalized forms are changed in the text and (unless the item was a typo with no underlying linguistic or cognitive relevance) the original form written by the author are recorded in the w elemant in the orig attribute. In certain cases of normalized content keeping the original form may be insightful with regards to the author/native speaker's perception of the lexical content being written.
Where there was a spelling by the author which separately wrote two items that should be written as one (such as future (potential) prefixes in front of a verb, these are wrapped in a common w and the orig is used to show the normalized value (without) whitespace.

Where the original did not follow spelling conventions and no white-space was involved and the items were changed to reflect the most up-to-date orthography conventions and the original form written by Tisu is recorded in the orig.

item.p: In both (//div/p/seg[@xml:lang='mix']/w and //div/salute/seg[@xml:lang='mix']/w): the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following locations: //div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[xml:lang='es'] (where preceding sibling is //seg) and //div/salute (where preceding sibling is //seg[@xml:lang='mix']); in both the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent

listChange.change: Normalization of original text are being made in //w[@orig]. Where two items (such as a verb and prefix) are written by Tisu separately, the separate w's are being wrapped in common w and this is where the translation will point to and the @norm attribute will be entered.

spanGrp.span: My friend Donny came over around 3:30 to pick us up then drove to the metro called BART.
Then we got out of the car, me and Shanty then got onto the metro.
Shanty came with me to the S.F airport.
Shanty vino conmigo al aeropuerto de S.F.
When we got in Donny's car, he said that it's very nice where I am going to go to.
He told me to be careful.
I should ask for direction so that someone doesn't steal my things.
Yo debería preguntar direcciónes para que alguien no me robe mis cosas.
When we arrived at BART, then we paid and got on the train.
Llegamos a BART, pues pagamos y subimos al tren.
It took us an hour to get to the airport.
Nos llevó una hora para llegar al aeropuerto.
When we arrived, we looked for Air Berlin.
When we found it then I spoke to the lady to get the ticket to board the plane.
the ticket to board the plane
el boleto para subirme al avión
When I got my boarding pass, I went to the other window so that the person could check in my bag.
Cuando recebí my tarjeta de embarque, fuí a la otra puerta de embarque para que el agente facture mi valija.
Then I went through security; I took off my shoes, I took out my computer, I took out the bag, I took out everything that I was carrying with me.
When I was done checking my bag, I walked through.
Cuando acabé de facturar mi valija, caminé y atravesé.
Then I was sitting down wating for the plane to arrive.
Pues me sentaba esperando la llegada del avión.
And then I was hungry so I went to buy something to eat.
Y tuve hambre entonces fuí para comprar algo a comer.
how should I tag this MWE phrase?
what tense is this verb form? can it be gloss and 1sg?
Then the plane arrived around 8pm and I boarded and it took off and left for Germany.
El avión lleguó alrededor de las ocho y me embarqué y decoló para Alemania.
It must have been flying for about an hour then I fell asleep.
I must have slept around four to seven hours but the flight lasted around eleven hours before we arrived in Vienna.
I arrived in Vienna around eight thirty.
Llegué a Viena cerca de las ocho y media.
cerca de las ocho y media en la noche
The plane must have flown ten hours, then it arrived in the city called Dusseldorf, Germany.
El avión debe haber volado diez horas, para llegar a la ciudad que se llama "Dusseldof, Alemania".
When I arrived there I got out of the plane then I went to the other area to catch the plane to go to Vienna.
I walked for around twenty minutes and then I arrived at the other area, then I was waiting around two and a half hours.
It wasn't until about six thirty before the plane arrived.
When I got on the plane I went to sleep because I was tired while I was sitting on the plane.
The plane flew around one hour and twenty five minutes and it arrived in Vienna around eight.
When I got out of the plane then I walked and came out because I requested a car to pick me up to take me to the hotel Regina.
When I came out of the airport I looked for where the agent was.
Then I walked and looked for them.
Then I found the agent after about 3 minutes, because he had my name written on a sign hung around his net so that I could see that that was the right man.
Then we left the airport and got in the car and drove to bring me over to Hotel Regina.
When I arrived at the hotel Regina and we took out my things and I walked to ask for the key to get in the room.
Then I changed clothes and I went to get something to eat.
Right now I ate and I really want to sleep, I'm very tired from sitting down on the airplane.
Then I went into my room and I slept for about eight hours.
When I got up, my back hurt from sitting down on the airplane.
And because of how bad my back was irritating, I wasn't able to sleep well on the plane.
Y por causa de cómo dolía la espalde, no pudo dormir bien en el aeroplano.
I was not able to sleep

p.seg:
Ntakoo kua ka iñu-sava cha ma nikuu ka ntakusu
yu .

spanGrp.span: I woke up around six thirty and couldn't go back to sleep.
I couldn't go back to sleep
I woke up, then took a shower, brushed my teeth, combed my hair, and got dressed.
Then I ate at the cafeteria.
I ate some food, such as eggs, and bacon.
Then I drank water and a small coffee (espresso).
Then after I ate I strolled around the area of my hotel.
nearby where my hotel is located
cerca de donde está mi hotel
When I was walking around around there (the hotel), I saw that there was a very big building.
It was a church and people were going inside and looking at it.
Fue a una iglesia y la gente estaba entrando y mirándolo.
And while sitting down, I saw that people were arriving with their dog.
The dog was very small, it was not a very big dog at all.
And right now I'm waiting for Jack to get here with his wife because they know where we are going to go walk around.
And I sat down on a bench when I got there.
Me senté en un banco cuando llegué allí.
And I saw on my watch that it was exactly ten o'clock.
Y cuando miré mi reloj ví que eran las diez en punto.
Then they arrived and we walked off and went.
We walked and at that moment we arrived at a building that looked like a church and Jack said that this building is the house of the government.
Then we walked and we will go to the center of this city of Vienna.
And then we arrived at a café.
And then we arrived at a place where people sell café and bread.
And then we were going to order something to eat.
Pues íamos a ir allí para ordenar algo a comer.
Then we were done, we packed up and left.
Pues terminamos, recogimos las cosas y nos fuimos.
We walked and we saw a building and by then two hours had passed.
I saw another church and a building that used to be a palace and one that is a palace now.
There were a lot of people walking around.
Here, there was a restaurant where we went to eat.
All three of us ordered chicken.
Then when we were done we walked back to the hotel.
It was about 4 o'clock when we got back here to the hotel.
I'll describe what I did when I woke up around seven.
I showered and I came down.
When I was done eating, I hit the road and I went to where I was going to meet Jack for our work.
When I arrived at where we were going to meet, I started to wait for him.
I waited there and he had not arrived, he wasn't visible.
And I was thinking that he would be arriving.
About eight minutes must have passed, then I started to walk around and look for him.
I was walking around for about five minutes then I found him, I met him on the other side (of the park).
Then we arrived at where he works.
Pues llegamos a dónde él trabaja.
at the place where he works
When we arrived, it was going to be about 10 o'clock.
We worked until it was about two o'clock, then we went to buy something to eat.
When we finished eating, we went back to work.
When I left I came back to the hotel where I was staying, it was about 6:30pm.
I arrived at a place that sold food and I bought a sandwich.
Because I walked so much on Sunday I was very tired, and when I finished eating I went to the hotel and layed down.
I watched TV and drank water.
Then I read a little and wrote something on my computer.
When it was around 10 I went to sleep.
I will tell about what I did today.
And so I got up around seven and I took a shower, I brushed my teeth and
Then I came down and went to eat.
Pues, yo subí y fuí a comer.
When I was done eating I hit the road and went to where I was meeting with Jack for work.
I got on the train and walked to where we were going to work.
When I arrived there, Jack was already waiting.
Then we met and we went to his office, the office where we were going to work.
When we got there it was already about nine o'clock.
We worked until about 1 and then we ate the stuff that we bought.
And so we went to the store where we met earlier and bought sandwiches and water.
And we ate that at around one o'clock.
Then we were done eating and we went back to work.
We worked until about five thirty then we walked from work.
When I came back and went into the hotel where I was staying it was about six o'clock.
When I arrived, I got onto the train and I looked for somewhere I could go to eat.
I walked a little bit and I went to a market where they sold food, then I bought a plate of shrimp to eat.
I bought a sangría to drink
When I finished eating, I went back to the hotel and relaxed a little bit.
I watched TV and drank water for about two hours.
Because they were speaking German I didn't understand what they were saying.
Then at around eleven I went to sleep.
I'm going to describe what I did today.
And so I got up around seven o'clock and I took a shower, brushed my teeth, and got dressed.
And then I went down and went to eat.
When I finished eating I hit the road and I went to where I was going to meet with Jack for our work.
I went on the way to get on the train.
I got onto the train and I went to work.
And then I arrived at where I was meeting Jack.
Then we met and we went to his office.
This day we did not buy sandwiches or any food.
When we arrived it was around nine o'clock and we started to work.
We worked until around one o'clock then we went to a restaurant to eat.
I ordered a hamburger and I drank water and then we left.
When we got back to the office, we worked and it was about 2:15pm.
We worked until around five thirty and after we left from work.
And today I didn't get on the train
Today I hit the road and walked back by foot.
I walked a lot and I passed by where the church that I saw on Saturday was.
I passed by a store again to buy a sack that I would take home.
Then I left again and walked, and came back it was getting late.
I walked back because I wanted to buy food at the market where I ate the other day, where I bought shrimp.
And I got there, and went in at around seven thirty.
a más o menos siete y media
Then I bought food to eat.
I ate a fish and drank water.
When I finished eating I walked (there) at around nine o'clock, I watched what people were doing.
At about nine o'clock I went into the hotel and I relaxed a little while.
I was watching TV and I was thinking "where are these people going"?
I went to sleep at around eleven.
I'm going to tell what I did today.
I got up at around seven and showered, brushed my teeth and got dressed.
And I came down and went to eat.
When I was done eating I hit the road and went to where I was going to meet with Jack for our work.
And on this day we agreed that we wouldn't meet until ten thirty for the reason that I was going to go to a market called Nasmark.
I was going to go to
I got onthe train at around nine fifteen because I wasn't going to have time to walk to the market.
I went but I couldn't walk around there because there wasn't time, I had to go to work at around ten.
I walked there in around twenty minutes and I went back, and went to the office.
I bought some food called salami, it is meat from a pig.
And then I arrived at work.
I arrived at work at around ten o'clock.
When I arrived there, Jack was already waiting..
Around eleven we went down and went to buy bread to eat with the salami.
Oh yeah, I bought cheese to put on my bread.
And I ate that at around one o'clock.
We didn't go to a restaurant to eat.
When we finished eating we worked until about five o'clock.
Then we came out and went back.
When I got to the train, I bought two sandwiches.
I carried them (sandwiches) and I got on the train.
I ate those (sandwiches) and I got off and drank water.
When I finished eating I watched TV for about two hours.
Then I went on my computer.
Then at about eleven thirty I went to sleep.
We have put in a full day of work.
related to light, pertaining to day time
We will be finished working when it’s around six o'clock, then we're going to go to eat.
Right now it’s around five thirty, and in twenty minutes we’re going to leave this work.
It’s already 6pm, we left work and were going to go out to eat.
Now, we are walking, going, and we have been walking for about 15 minutes
We already arrived and we were waiting for Cassandra to get here because we are all going to eat.
Ten minutes had already passed by and she arrived.
We sat down, and then we left and went to eat food.
Right now we are ordering beer and water.
He (the waiter) is going to get the food and he'll come back (with it).
He brought beer and water, and now he’s going to bring us food.
Cassandra also ordered chicken to eat.
Here we drank beer and waited for the food to come.
Now we're talking about what we used to do when we were little kids.
We're also telling (stories) about what we did when we went to school
It has already been ten minutes and this man is arriving with food now.
The food here is really good.
I ate a lot of chicken here.
The pork that Jack is eating here is really good.
check with Jerry on use of this phrase. Is "nchu'a" needed?
We drank beer as time was passing
And it will be nine at night.
Now we're going to another store where they sell coffee.
Y ahora, vamos a otra tienda dondé se vende café.
The guy (waiter) came and we paid for this food.
And he (the waiter) came and asked us if we wanted more beer.
And we said we had already finished and we were going over to another place.

how to translate the Spanish preterite form as the Mixtec doesn't have the inflection? Also, look into the use of this verb, it seems to have different behavior with regards to inflection and it often doesn't inflect.
And then we paid, we packed up and left.
We walked and walked and we arrived at the other building where they sell coffee.
Caminamos y caminamos y pues llegamos al outro edificio dónde se vende café.
These verbs not being in the completive emphasizes no start and end point in the concept.s
We arrived and we sat down.
I wanted to drink a coffee.
Jack and Cassandra ordered coffee and pastries and we ate.
And there was alcohol in the coffee that we drank.
Y había alcohól en el café que bebimos.
And we're sitting here talking to eachother.
We paid and we left to go home.
And it was around ten thirty.
It must have been around eleven o'clock, I went home.
And then we went home, to where they live there (in Vienna).
I got back in about ten minutes.
I got on one train, and Jack and Cassandra got on another.
This day is over, and tomorrow will be Saturday.
Today is Friday and we found out that there is this document that exists that our people wrote 500 years ago.
Hoy es viernes y acabamos de aprender que hay un documento que existe que nustro pueblo escribó hace 500 años.
It is displayed in a building called the National Library of Vienna, Austria.
Esté espuesto en un edificio llamado el Biblioteca Nacional de Viena, Austria.
And today we will go see if we are able to see this document.
Y hoy vamos a ir se poderemos ver este documento.
It was about 9:30 and I will pick up clothes and will leave this hotel because I will be going over to Jack's house.
I will arrive there I'll leave my clothes and we'll turn around and go look for the document.

p.seg:
Cha vichi tsa
kui ka
utsi-sava , cha tsa ntachiko
kue nuu nani Karlsplatz , sara sana kunku'un kue ntatuku kue biblioteka ka .

spanGrp.span: At this point, it's already 10:30 and we already turned around at a place called Karlsplatz then after we went to look for the library.
En este momento, ya son las diez y media y ya nos daremos vuelta a un lugar llamado Karlsplatz, pues, fuimos para buscar la biblioteca.
And right now we are walking and are on our way.
Y ahora caminamos y estamos en camino.
Let's go left because this way is where the library is.
Vamos a la izquierda porque la biblioteca está por aquí.
To the right, to the left there are big buildings, old buildings.
Al derecho, al izquierda, habian edificios grandes, edificios viejos.

p.seg:
- Yo'o yee nchai
va'a , yee ña nani “
Hot dog
/
perro caliente
.

spanGrp.span: Here there is really good food, that's called "hot dog", "perro caliente".
Aquí hay una muy buena comida, llamado "hot dog", "perro caliente".

p.seg:
” Ana kuni katsi in “ hot dog
" ? .

spanGrp.span: Who wants to eat a hot dog?
And I wasn't going to eat it because I ate it yesterday.
Y yo no quieriá comerlo porque acobo de comer ayer.
and it didn't taste good, I said.
And we left and went to a place where they sell coffee.
Then we went to where the library was and we stayed outside with the coffee.
Y fuimos a la biblioteca y estuvimos afuera con los cafés.
Because we could not enter the library with coffee.
Porque no pudimos entrar a la biblioteka con café.
We were happy because we were at the entrance to the library.
Estábamos felizes porque estuvimos a la entrada de la biblioteca.
And we were going to go in and see the codexes.
Y íbamos a entrar para ver los codices
we were going to go in
We all finished our coffees and we went and entered the library.
Terminamos los cafés y fuimos y entramos a la biblioteca.
We arrived and we paid to enter.
We were allowed to go into the library.
Fuimos permitidos a entrar la biblioteca.
Right now we are walking and are looking for the document.
Ahora mismo estamos caminando y buscamos el documento.
Let's go to where that woman is and ask where the document is displayed.
Vámos a donde está aquella mujer para preguntar dónde está el documento.
Then Cassandra asked and this woman said that the other library is where the codex document is.
Y Cassandra le preguntó y esta mujer dijó que es la outra biblioteca donde se expone el codice documento.
It is located in the other library that's about one block from here.
Está situado en la outra biblioteca que se ubica alrededor de una cuadra de aquí.
It was to the left and we left and walked to where the other library was.
Se ubicó a la izquierda y nos fuimos y caminamos hasta donde se ubicó la otra biblioteca.
Now we arrived and Jack asked about the document and the attendant told him that it is located here but we can't see it because this library is closed.
Ahora, llegamos y Jack preguntó sobre este documento y la persona le dijó que se ubica aquí pero no podríamos verlo porque esta biblioteca está cerrada.
we wouldn't be able to see
By the end of September the building will open and until then, then we will be able to see this document.
A finales de septiembre el edificio abriría y hasta entonces, pues nos podríamos ver este documento.
we will be able to see
It's a very sad day today because I couldn't see the document that our people wrote five hundred years ago.
Es un día muy triste hoy porque no pude ver el documento que escribío nuestro pueblo hace quinientos años.
I stayed behind and wandered around and Jack and Cassandra went home.
Pues me quedé y dí una vuelta y Jack y Cassandra se fueron a casa.
Now I'm going to go to a store and then I'm going to go to a palace called Schönbrunn.
Ahora yo voy a ir a una tienda y pues voy a ir a un palacio llamado "Schönbrunn".

p.seg: Cha tsa kui ka in- sava ra kunku'un yu nuu inkaa in ve'e , in palasio ña nani Schonbrunn .

spanGrp.span: It was already one thirty and I was going to where there was a building, a palace that is called Schönbrunn.
I went to get onto the train.
Me fui para subirme al tren.
And I arrived and got on the train.
Y llegué y me subí al tren.
This train was going to arrive in around twenty minutes.
El tren llegaría en aproximadamente viente minutos.
And it was already about 2:30pm and I have to got to the other store and buy a device to charge my telephone
And I got off of this train and I walked over to the store.
I arrived and I spoke with this person to show me where the device that I'm looking for is.
Yo llegué y hablé con una persona para que me mostraría dónde está el aparto para que estoy buscando.
I found this device and I'm going to pay for it.
Encontré este aparto y voy a pagarlo.
And I walked back and was going to get on the train here in order to go to Schönbrunn.
It took about 15 minutes to arrive
I'm looking for where it is.
And it's not visible and I don't want to ask people where it is.
I walked back and turned around on the other side and found it.
Regresé andando y me dí vuelta y lo encontré.
And I had an hour to walk around a little because I have to meet up with Jack and Cassandra at 4pm.
I arrived at where the entrance and then I went in, and this building was really big
And there are many different houses here.
and i was going to go in the back. and when I arrived in the back it was way bigger in the back (than anticipated)...
And then I had to run so that I could see all the houses that are here.
It was already 4pm and I was going to meet Jack and Cassandra near the door.
Then we were going to eat.
Entonces íbamos a ir a comer.
I stayed at another hotel today.
I went to walk around because it's the last day that I will be here, then tomorrow I leave.
At eleven o'clock I'm going to look for something to eat because I'm hungry.
I caugh the train and I went to Karlsplatz.
There I want to eat bread and drink a coffee.
At 10:15 in the morning, I am here I bought bread and coffee.
I bought bread and coffee and I am here eating it.
When I'm done I will go to buy things to bring home.
I'd put 'ña' after this, Jerry agrees.

p.seg: Michut'ni tsa kui kua ka in-sava tsini .

spanGrp.span: Right now it's already 1:30 in the afternoon.
I already bought the things that I'll bring home.
I bought a lot of bags
And now I'm going to put.. everything in my bag.
And I'm waiting for the train here because I'm going to where Jack lives because we are going to the forest.
And the this train is already going am on it and on my way.

p.seg: Cha yachi tsa kunkui ka uvi-sava , ra kuu nuu , kunkee nuu treen yo vichi .

spanGrp.span: It's already almost 2:30, and I'm getting off the train now.
And I'm going to where Jack lives.
There are really old buildings on this street, there are really big trees and there are a lot of birds.
I arrived at Jack's house and we were ready to go walk in the forest.
We turned around and went back and put on a jacket, then we carried a bottle of water.
All three of us, me, Jack and Cassandra.
And now we are going walking now.
We are walking and we arrived at where the gate and we went in and we are going to climb this hill.
Jack said that there are lot's of wild boar here.
Just as we entered, one of them came out, it's coming towards us.
It was a big pig, it's a black one and and two teeth are showing on it's mouth.
Then I took three photos of it.
We walked to a small hill; we walked in order to go up to the top of the hill.
We climbed the other small (hill), then we saw another wild boar and it was there eating grass.
We took a couple photos of the boar and they looked bad because it was very far away.
When we were finished taking photos of the wild boar, we went on.
We're walking and we came up to the top of this hill at the moment.
Jack and Cassandra said they saw a small snake when he came here once.
And we're looking to find what it looks like here.
He says that it won't come out because it's hot right now.
We sat down in the woods and drank water because it was a little hot.
We got up and then we kept walking.

p.seg:
Ntsaa kue nuu in “letrero ,” ntakania ña yee sa'va , yee likui , yee chumi , yee taka , yee ntikuain , yee ntiva'u , tsi inka kue itsi ña ntsini
yu nixi nani .

spanGrp.span: We came to a buletin board that said that there were frogs, toads, owls, woodpeckers, squirrels, coyotes and other insects that I don't know the names of.
We walked, we came down and crossed over to a place where there is a small lake.
On the path we are walking here, people are walking into the woods.

p.seg:
Tsa kui ka kumi-sava cha tsa tsika kue ntachiko inka ye'e ka , nuu ntsini
kue kini yuku .

spanGrp.span: At about 4:30 we are turning around we already walked and come back to the other gate where we saw the boar.
We walked back and we went home.
When we walked we were talking about that this foresst was really nice.
We walked and we arrived at the house.
Right now we're going to make food. We're hungry from hiking.
When we are finished eating I'm going to shower because tomorrow I'm going to get up early because I'm leaving.
is this the potential form of "tsitsa'an"?
